snippet: Ami James, a tattoo artist with studios in Miami and New York City, is not too tough to admit he has a fear of flying.
abstract: Frequent Flier column features tattoo artist Ami James discussing his flying experiences. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: I HAVE a green card and a lot of tattoos. For many years, that combination meant I spent a lot of time in a lot of holding rooms. Now that's changed. Some people recognize me because of my reality television show, ''Miami Ink,'' so that gets me a pass. But I think it's mostly because tattoos have become so widely accepted. I've met cops, nerds, judges, immigration officials, even grandmas who have tattoos. The security guys now show off their tattoos to me.
